heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 11 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.2°C) and outside temperature (down 1.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 5971 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 7448 lux) and cloud levels (up 581 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 4.8m higher than yesterday, 205.0m lower than the past week, 581.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 866m minimum and 3020m maximum, with an average of 1722.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1927.0m and 2300m.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

Yesterday, the dew point temperatures ranged from a minimum of 8.5°C to a maximum of 12.9°C, averaging 8.9°C; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 11.2°C and 12.0°C respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and periods of sunshine are expected. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
